alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 17 at 2:24AM EST until January 17 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Northeastern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 300 AM EST. * At 224 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Tinton Falls, or near Asbury Park, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Howell, Carteret, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Matawan, Highlands, Farmingdale, East Freehold, Elberon, Navesink, Collingwood Park, Lincroft, Freewood Acres, Allenwood and Eatontown. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 13. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 27 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 97 and 120. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
